comment.author: 22584609@N02
comment._content: ah...what a portrait...I am always amazed by the quality of such a photographs. beautiful!

comment.author: 26230150@N08
comment._content: I admire the costumes from the beginning of the 19th century !

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The animal rights people would have a field day, loads of tail-less pheasants, ostriches, birds of paradise and blackcocks to adorn the hats, minks, ermines, foxes and beavers rendered naked to warm their necks and good calfskin leather for those soft bootees!  Having said that this is an excellent shot, very well composed with just the one lady excised from the group (probably too much of a gossip).  I'd say there was a lot of jockeying for position in that group????

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Oh, absolutely! And I take your point about our feathered and four-legged friends. I was nearly going to add this one to our animal set: 4 Legs Good, 2 Legs Bad...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 54708393@N08
comment._content: A number of the ladies are sporting AOH badges. Large groups in a small studio are all ways challenging but to also add large hats!.Mr Poole I salute you sir!.

comment.author: 72025404@N08
comment._content: amazing portrait! I wonder how would be like these people in the modern days... Pictures like this really are a time machine in many aspects

comment.author: 8087163@N05
comment._content: If you want to get ahead ...get a hat!  Wonderful shot Carol

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/54708393@N08] They are indeed! Have scrutinised the badges from all angles, but can't make out the rest of the wording...

Mr Poole and his painstaking staff are long overdue an official salute, so I might upload a photo of A.H. himself one of the days, what do you think?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32149975@N07
comment._content: Well done on getting into the Flickr Blog!

comment.author: 45179809@N00
comment._content: I am really fond of the one on the far left of the photo ("stage right"), she's pretty cute !

comment.author: 33752399@N00
comment._content: The lady in the back, the exceptionally tall one...was she actually present?  She looks much "flatter" than the others (and exceptionally tall), almost as though they posed in front of a portrait and left a space for the subject.  If she was there, and that tall, she must have been truly an exceptional woman at that time, she stands nearly a head and shoulders taller than any of the rest.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyrieowl] She was definitely present! Tall? Or perhaps the others were quite short?  :)
